OrgName.entry: CENTRAL CHILDRENS AND YOUNG PEOPLES LIBRARY

Desc.entry: Part of Sheffield Libraries, Archives and Information. Provides a comprehensive library service to children, young people and families in a welcoming environment. Offers lending facilities for books, talking books on tape and CD, DVDs, dual language material and limited special needs material. There is a small reference collection, a public access catalogue and three People's Network computers for children's use. Comfortable area for toddlers reading and play. Regular activities include pre-school Story Time session, with related activities, baby and toddler sessions, Chatterbooks reading group for 8-12 year olds and Books Aloud reading group for young adults. Also holiday activities and a programme of promotional reading events for children and families. There is also a homework zone where staff are on hand to suggest relevant books or websites. Groups and class visits by arrangement. Toilet and baby changing facilities available.

ProviderServiceDetails.entry: Mon-Fri 10.30am-5.30pm, Sat 9.30am-5.30pm; Mon 10.45am-12noon (pre-school Story Time session, term-time only), Fri 10.30-12noon (baby and toddler session, term-time only)
